docs.lead_paragraph: French fashion house Christian Dior is seeing blue for women's wardrobes next winter, with artistic director Maria Grazia Chiuri turning to one of the preferred colors of the luxury label's founding designer for her latest collection.

headline.print_headline: Dior Sees Blue, Issey Miyake Looks to Northern Lights at Paris Shows
headline.main: Dior Sees Blue, Issey Miyake Looks to Northern Lights at Paris Shows

docs.snippet: French fashion house Christian Dior is seeing blue for women's wardrobes next winter, with artistic director Maria Grazia Chiuri turning to one of the preferred colors of the luxury label's founding designer for her latest collection....

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of civilians escaping the fighting in Mosul has increased significantly as battles intensify between U.S.-backed Iraqi forces and Islamic State militants, and some have been exposed to chemical agents, the Red Cross said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Mosul Victims Treated for Chemical Agents as Displacement Accelerates
headline.main: Mosul Victims Treated for Chemical Agents as Displacement Accelerates

docs.snippet: The number of civilians escaping the fighting in Mosul has increased significantly as battles intensify between U.S.-backed Iraqi forces and Islamic State militants, and some have been exposed to chemical agents, the Red Cross said on Friday....

docs.lead_paragraph: Financial technology firms in Brazil are grouping to discuss with local watchdogs how to regulate the fast-growing sector, in which the number of players has risen roughly six-fold over the past couple of years.

headline.print_headline: Brazil's Fast-Growing Fintechs Form Groups to Discuss Regulation
headline.main: Brazil's Fast-Growing Fintechs Form Groups to Discuss Regulation

docs.snippet: Financial technology firms in Brazil are grouping to discuss with local watchdogs how to regulate the fast-growing sector, in which the number of players has risen roughly six-fold over the past couple of years....

docs.lead_paragraph: An employee of a Rhode Island city wasn't sleeping on the job — it appears he was sleeping at his job.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. International Trade Commission said on Friday it had made a final finding that the U.S. industry was being harmed by the dumping and subsidization of imports of carbon and alloy steel cut-to-length plate from China.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Finds China Steel Plate Imports Injure U.S. Industry
headline.main: U.S. Finds China Steel Plate Imports Injure U.S. Industry

docs.snippet: The U.S. International Trade Commission said on Friday it had made a final finding that the U.S. industry was being harmed by the dumping and subsidization of imports of carbon and alloy steel cut-to-length plate from China....

docs.lead_paragraph: A criminal investigation involving several people close to Matteo Renzi, including his father and his right-hand man, is muddying the image of the former Italian prime minister and threatening his prospects of a return to power.

headline.print_headline: Italy's Renzi Sees Comeback Threatened by Public Tenders Scandal
headline.main: Italy's Renzi Sees Comeback Threatened by Public Tenders Scandal

docs.snippet: A criminal investigation involving several people close to Matteo Renzi, including his father and his right-hand man, is muddying the image of the former Italian prime minister and threatening his prospects of a return to power....

docs.lead_paragraph: A mother and one of her children were killed, a second child was rescued and a third was missing Friday after a car plunged into the California Aqueduct in the high desert city of Hesperia.

headline.print_headline: Car Plunges Into California Aqueduct, 2 Killed and 1 Rescued
headline.main: Car Plunges Into California Aqueduct, 2 Killed and 1 Rescued

docs.snippet: A mother and one of her children were killed, a second child was rescued and a third was missing Friday after a car plunged into the California Aqueduct in the high desert city of Hesperia....

docs.lead_paragraph: About 62,000 people who were held at an Aurora immigration detention center and required to work for as little as $1 a day have joined together in a class-action lawsuit.

headline.main: Aurora Immigration Center Detainees Join Class-Action Suit

docs.snippet: About 62,000 people who were held at an Aurora immigration detention center and required to work for as little as $1 a day have joined together in a class-action lawsuit....
